greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of n indistinguishable copies of 1..5 with every partial sum <= the same partial sum averaged over all permutations.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..47
maple: b:= proc(l) option remember; local m, n, g;
mathematica: b[l_] := b[l] = Module[{m, n, g}, {m, n} = {Length[l], Total[l]}; g = Sum[i*l[[i]], {i, 1, m}] - (m + 1)/2*(n - 1); If[n < 2, 1, Sum[If[l[[i]] > 0 && i <= g, b[ReplacePart[l, i -> l[[i]] - 1]], 0], {i, 1, m}]]];
a /@ Range[0, 15] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 18 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 16 2012
